tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V3.0.0.0 -- build 3 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop (1990)
programme.desc: A tough cop must pose as a kindergarten teacher in order to locate a dangerous criminal's ex-wife, who may hold the key to putting him behind bars

programme.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu (2019)
programme.desc: In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective

programme.title: Shazam! (2019)
programme.desc: A newly fostered young boy in search of his mother instead finds unexpected super powers and soon gains a powerful enemy

programme.title: Hellboy (2019)
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novels by Mike Mignola, Hellboy, caught between the worlds of the supernatural and human, battles an ancient sorceress bent on revenge

programme.title: Midway (2019)
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, told by the leaders and the sailors who fought it

programme.title: World War Z (2013)
programme.desc: Former United Nations employee Gerry Lane traverses the world in a race against time to stop a zombie pandemic that is toppling armies and governments and threatens to destroy humanity itself

programme.title: Calvin Harris: In the Park Festival (2016)
programme.desc: 1. Sweet Nothing 2. Bitch Better Have My Money 3. Under Control 4. Bounce 5. Safe And Sound 6. This Is What You Came For 7. I Need Your Love 8. Thinking About You 9. You Got The Love 10. Outside 11. Hype 12. Feel So Close 13. Eat, Sleep, Rave, Repeat 14. Lean On 15. Hideaway 16. Hello 17. We Found Love 18. One More Time 19. Thats Not Me 20. How Deep Is Your Love 21. Summer 22. Blame

programme.title: Limp Bizkit: Reading Festival (2015)
programme.desc: 1. Rollin' (Air Raid Vehicle) 2. Hot Dog 3. Gold Cobra 4. My Generation 5. My Way 6. Boiler 7. Killing In The Name 8. Faith 9. Break Stuff 10. Take A Look Around

programme.title: To Be Decided
programme.desc: Random TV shows, music and movies

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Chris Mason and Rachel Burden present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Andrew Marr is joined by Dominic Raab MP, first secretary of state, Nicola Sturgeon MSP, first minister of Scotland, Rachel Reeves MP, shadow chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, Isabella Lovin, Swedish deputy prime ministe, Andreas Michaelis, German Foreign Office secretary, Professor Christophe Fraser, Oxford University, advising on the NHSX app and Professor Brian Cox, physicist. News review with Camilla Tominey, associate editor, The Telegraph and Hugh Pym, BBC health editor.(n)

programme.title: Politics North West
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Worship
programme.desc: The Rt Rev Rose Hudson-Wilkin, Bishop of Dover, leads a service for the Third Sunday after Easter from Hereford Cathedral, in a programme filmed before the closure of all church buildings was announced. With hymns recorded for Songs of Praise in 2017.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Persephone and Debbie sample life in New Zealand, believing the country to offer a more attractive culture and society for same sex couples.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and Raj Bisram help two teams scour an antiques fair in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about the appeal of Robert 'Mouseman' Thompson's work. The buys later go under the hammer at Beverley Racecourse to determine whixch side has made the greater profit.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher looks back to when the programme has ventured to ancient and sacred places of pilgrimage, including Lourdes and the spectacular abbey of Mont St Michel in France.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents an appeal on behalf of Whizz-Kidz, a charity working to transform the lives of disabled children across the UK, supporting them to become confident and independent young adults.(n)

programme.title: The 1981 London Marathon: A Historical First
programme.desc: In March 1981, the very first London marathon was held, with just over 7,000 entrants taking part in the race. while nearly 40 years on there are now more than 40,000 participants, making it one of the biggest and best-loved events in the sporting calendar. This special programme looks back at that historic first staging of the event, reliving the remarkable finish to the men's race - which ended in a dead heat - and all observed through the backdrop of how London looked then.(n)

programme.title: Penguins - Spy in the Huddle
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates an insight into this most intriguing and comical of birds, beginning with three different species' journeys to reach their breeding grounds. Emperor penguins cross a treacherous frozen sea, and rockhoppers brave stormy seas, before they come ashore and face a daunting assault up a 300ft cliff where they are vulnerable to predators. Meanwhile, the tropical humboldts have to evade sea lions, dodge vampire bats and battle sea birds in order to lay their eggs in the desert. All the while, their every move is being secretly filmed by hidden spy technology, including robotic penguins with cameras for eyes.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus Daily Update: BBC News Special
Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The Rich brothers and Arit Anderson travel to Shefford in Bedfordshire, where they meet a couple who claim their garden is basic and plain. Duncan would like it to be modern, but also contain elements of a rustic, cottage garden. Both he and Karen like the idea of a curved patio and wish to avoid decking. Will the couple choose the Rich brothers proposed design, complete with bespoke veg beds, pair of curved hedges and paved courtyard, or will Arit's design that offers a new circular lawn, choice of paved seating areas and a vertical waterfall be more to their taste?(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: With the country still in lockdown, Matt Baker is on his home patch, building a pond, meeting a peregrine that lacks the confidence to hunt, and getting crafty with the paintbrushes in his back garden. Wildlife film-maker Jack Perks reveals the world beneath the water of his garden pond, Adam Henson has a lot a lot of hungry mouths to feed on his farm, and Kate Humble takes viewers round her home village to find out how the community is pulling together in these challenging times.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce pays a return visit to Castle Ward in Co Down, delving into the story of scientist, author and astronomer Mary Ward, who lived in the mansion in the 19th century. Items assessed by the team include two sculptures made out of ostrich eggs and a watch designed for astronauts to wear on the Moon, while military expert Robert Tilney unearths some top secret D-Day plans.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a programme looking at the family of mammals, beginning by revealing the extraordinary strategies monkeys, apes and lemurs must use to survive in the most unexpected places. In South Africa, rarely seen bush babies go in search of food in the lean times of winter, while times are also hard for a troop of bearded capuchins in Brazil's scorched badlands.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: Carolyn and Eve are left reeling, while Villanelle finds that management is not all that it is cracked up to be. Eve strikes up an unlikely alliance with Kenny's colleagues at the Bitter Pill. Spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: The Elephant Man
programme.desc: In 1884, ambitious young surgeon Frederick Treves is intrigued by a sideshow freak billed as the Elephant Man. He finds, behind the disfigured exhibit, an intelligent person called John Merrick, whose rehabilitation he undertakes, with the severely deformed man's life being transformed by the friendship that develops between the two. Fact-based drama directed by David Lynch, starring John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller and Freddie Jones.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Dr Xand Van Tulleken and Michelle Ackerley return to guide viewers through the challenges of keeping mentally and physically healthy during the lockdown. Angela Rippon has her daily pick of thoughts and messages from the programme' inbox, and Mr Motivator presents another home workout.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell check out a quirky terraced house in Birmingham, a flat in a Glasgow high rise block, and a former taxi cab office in Upper Holloway.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A doctor and a paramedic try to save the life of a hiker who fell 650ft, while a motorist takes evasive action when a car heads towards him on the wrong side of the road.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi receives a message from prison, while Zara struggles to tackle Joe's stubbornness, and Ruhma pushes the definition of the word suspension. Valerie visits a care home, where she tries to help two old army colleagues make peace with each other and the past.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a businesswoman and her best friend to find a calming Hampshire home on a budget of Â£950,000, and also visits Portsmouth's Spinnaker Tower.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: More products are put to the test, with consumers unboxing, trying out and giving their feedback on a gadget for wheelie bins, a measuring tool and dry shampoo for children.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth tour the country lanes of Northern Ireland in their Rolls-Royce. Angus has designs on a piece of Victorian furniture while Roo hits the dance floor.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan present the stories that matter from across the country.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Has the Government Failed the NHS - Panorama
programme.desc: Doctors and nurses have been warning for weeks that they don't have enough protective kit to stay safe. Richard Bilton investigates whether the government let down health workers leading the fight against the coronavirus, looking at the delays and mistakes that may have put the lives of NHS staff at risk.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gray and Sonia are puzzled by Whitney's disappearance, Linda feels uncomfortable when she spots Phil at her alcoholics support group and Suki questions Chantelle's dedication to her new job - but luckily Kheerat intervenes. Patrick and Isaac start to bond although Isaac is left suspicious when Patrick drops a hint about the truth. Dotty promotes a club night at Ruby's in an attempt to make some much-needed cash - and takes the opportunity to flirt with Peter as she invites him along. Callum nervously waits for the results of his police assessment and Mitch quizzes Mick about the future of the Vic.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Angela Scanlon and John Simm join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack, hoping to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.(n)

programme.title: Normal People
programme.desc: In a school in a small town in the west of Ireland, Connell is a well-liked, good-looking and athletic student, while Marianne is a proud, intimidating and unpopular loner who actively avoids her classmates and questions her teachers' authority. An attraction sparks between the two when Connell comes to collect his mother Lorraine, who works at Marianne's house, and a deep connection grows between the two teenagers - one they cannot stop but that they are determined to conceal from their peers. Adaptation of Sally Rooney's novel, starring Paul Mescal and Daisy Edgar-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Normal People
programme.desc: The teenagers' relationship continues in secret and they sleep together for the first time. At school, Connell makes excuses for why he didn't see his friends at the weekend and evades questions about his mother's job, while Marianne must find a way to explain her unplanned absences to her prying brother Alan.(n)

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: The gang has to get out of Small Heath, but Mobeen needs to tie up loose ends and guarantee his sister's safety before the police or Khan's gang take him down. Comedy, starring Guz Khan, with Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Emma Barnett and Henning Wehn joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories, before connecting to another group of Hollywood A-listers and British TV big shots via the internet. Plus, the notorious Red Chair feature, now relocated to the comfort of a viewer's own armchair at home.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Daily advice for viewers in self-isolation due to the Covid-19 outbreak.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a house in London's Plaistow, a shell of a property in Lancashire, and a flat in Stoke-on-Trent as they are sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A boy taking part in a karting race is sent flying into the air while his father watches helplessly, and a man who dived into a river to save a drowning dog needs rescuing as well.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts as experts Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help the reds and blue teams find bargains at the antiques centre in Elsecar, South Yorkshire. Plus, Anita views a Meissen collection.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid and Bear bond, while Valerie's lunch plans are anything but a picnic. Daniel's old friend gets more than he bargained for when he sets up a dating website.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps an Oxford couple find a new home on the West Sussex coast, and dons protective gear to join a conservation project protecting nature's most productive workers.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Consumers get to grips with educational artistic toys, cleaning products designed for getting rid of pet hair, and a pregnancy extension panel for a walking jacket.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth traverse south-west Wales, where they learn about traditional boats and sheep farming before attending an auction in Carmarthen.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Peter realises Bobby has a crush on Dotty and knocks his brother's confidence - but it doesn't stop the teenager turning up at the club and doing his best to impress the hostess. Linda is adamant she cannot return to her support group with Phil there, leaving Shirley and Mick frustrated. A powercut adds to the tensions between Gray and Chantelle, while Denise realises Patrick and Sheree are both hiding something and hatches a plan to uncover what is going on.(n)

programme.title: Life and Birth
programme.desc: A 22-year-old father-to-be must face his fear of surgery when his partner needs a caesarean section after the baby's heart rate starts to dip. A mother of four boys prepares to give birth to her fifth child, and being an old hand at delivery, soon has a new addition to her brood with no complications. A high-risk pregnancy is closely monitored, and a woman who has been in the hospital for a week is still waiting for the birth of her first baby to begin - but she and her partner are prepared to work as a team when the time comes.(n)

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Georgie returns to active duty in Afghanistan in the run-up to election day, and discovers that the fake Omar being held in custody has admitted to being a decoy. Georgie is advised to keep a low profile following her recent troubles, but after an assassination attempt on a US dignitary, she realises what is really going on - Elvis' killer is closer to home than she thought and planning a devastating attack. Mimi comes to terms with her past, Throbber earns his stripes, and Dr Bahil looks to the future.(n)

programme.title: Hot Property
programme.desc: Yung Filly helps a bisexual woman from Manchester who has never had a girlfriend to explore the bedrooms of three potential partners, leading her to uncover some surprises and one very familiar looking bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: Carolyn and Eve are left reeling, while Villanelle finds that management is not all that it is cracked up to be. Eve strikes up an unlikely alliance with Kenny's colleagues at the Bitter Pill. Spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: A special edition of Talking Movies Tom Brook and his team report from home with stories on New York's Tribeca Film Festival which in the midst of the pandemic has gone virtual. (12+).(n)

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Deforestation has skyrocketed in Colombia since the peace deal of 2016. Our World joins a team of scientists from the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew as they go on a mission into virgin tropical rainforest. They hope to discover and save rare plant species before they are destroyed and vanish forever..(n)

programme.title: The Papers

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical tour through the BBC's culinary archive, this time selecting recipes and ingredients linked by the letter F. The Hairy Bikers cook a focaccia and Nigel Slater serves roast figs with honey and marsala.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke turn their attention to a bland, rented front-space in Dalkeith, Midlothian, which they hope to transform into a productive and pretty cottage garden.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presenter Rachel de Thame visits stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the first edition of a new look for the programme, Anita Rani is on her home patch in east London to discover what lockdown means for Woodberry Wetlands and what the future holds for the animals of Hackney City Farm. At home, she gets stuck into reinvigorating her garden and cooks up a barbecue tandoori. Adam Henson reveals the effects of the pandemic on farming and Tom Heap investigates how a new British land army might work for fruit and veg growers.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson is given unique access to the Royal Botanic Gardens in Edinburgh and George allows us unique access to his precious tool shed. Plus, Carole Baxter and Brian Cunningham answer viewers' gardening questions.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The latest two highest-scoring South West chefs cook their six-course menus again to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The arbitrators are joined by comedian and children's author Nina Wadia, who has a special interest in cuisine for children with diabetes. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
programme.desc: A Home Guard officer serving during the Second World War is outraged by the disrespect for tradition shown by younger soldiers. He looks back on his military adventures during the Boer War and First World War, as well as his three great loves. Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger's satirical drama, starring Roger Livesey, Deborah Kerr, Anton Walbrook and John Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Stephen Hendry v Ronnie O'Sullivan. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2002 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison come up with virtual reality designs to transform a Halifax couple's 19th-century home. When owner Paula developed MS, it became vital to make the house more wheelchair accessible - but her partner Jeremy also sees an opportunity to give it a stylish new look. Laura's concept makes the most of the views of the garden and uses clever recycling tricks to stretch the budget, while Robert deploys off-the-shelf materials to making the place more accessible.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a soup factory in Wigan that produces 2.5 million cans a day, and follows the production of a tin of vegetable soup from a pea harvest to the eventual dispatch. He also encounters a pressure cooker that stands 27.4 metres tall. Cherry Healey compares the vitamin content of fresh and frozen vegetables, and visits a salt mine in Crewe, while historian Ruth Goodman cooks up a butterted spinach soup using a recipe from a 17th-century cookbook, which is the earliest known reference to soup in English.(n)

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A journey around the region, examining the challenges currently facing the nations in the area. In the first episode, Simon visits Malta, uncovering the country's reputation for organised crime, before moving on to the southern coast of Italy, where he joins police officers exploring underground tunnels used by crime bosses on the run. Finally, he arrives in Albania and discovers an ancient tradition of revenge where children can pay the price for their parents' actions.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams embark on the final leg of their journey, heading off on the 4,800 kilometre trek to the finish line in Ushuaia, Argentina, the most southerly city in the world. However, as they prepare to leave the last checkpoint, one of the teams reveals that they have run out of money and will not be completing the challenge. The three remaining pairs rely on different tactics to get ahead, benefiting from risky gambles, lucky opportunities and the kindness of strangers.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.desc: The presenter reports on how southern Spain has become the main gateway for drugs into Europe, leading to violent turf wars between gangs and a government crackdown as the police struggle to regain control of their streets. Stacey goes on aerial patrol with police officers guarding the strip of water between Morocco and Spain, and discovers the extraordinary lengths smugglers will take to evade them, including travelling at 100mph in speedboats during extreme weather conditions.(n)

programme.title: Trigonometry
programme.desc: Gemma, Ray and Kieran's unity is challenged by a sudden tragedy, and a misunderstanding also leads to a showdown. Gemma rushes back to her childhood home in the wake of the shocking turn of events, Kieran suffers a panic attack which calls his future as a paramedic into question, and Ray finds herself faced with a hard decision.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Homemade Show
programme.desc: Rough-and-ready self-made comedy show featuring Scottish comedian Limmy, aka Brian Limond. Limmy feels guilty about accidentally leaving his phone's stopwatch running and has a lifesaving idea that Scotland can give to the world. He is also unhappy about the placement of the letter Q in the alphabet.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The fragile truce between the vampires and Staten Island's werewolves is put to the test, and only a trial by combat can resolve matters. Colin Robinson finds romance with a new co-worker, who can match him for her ability to spread misery. Arj Barker (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars as the leader of the gang's lycanthropic rivals.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The housemates venture into Manhattan to try and form an alliance with a powerful old friend, who has risen to become the king of the city's vampires. Laszlo dons his most sinister hat for the occasion, despite Nadja's protests that it is cursed, while Guillermo is left feeling unappreciated by his master.(n)

programme.title: Titian - Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The story behind the artist's commission for Philip II of Spain, known as the poesie paintings, which had not been seen together for over 450 years and had been the subject of an exhibition at London's National Gallery before it was closed due to the Covid-19 outbreak. Cameras were recently granted access to bring this groundbreaking exhibition to the screens across Britain and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Fraud Squad NHS
programme.desc: Fraud specialists seek a serial scam artist faking disability to claim thousands of pounds in insurance payouts, and also uncover the most prolific dental fraudster ever. Plus, a preacher turns prisoner when he's caught with his hand in the public purse. Presented by Michelle Ackerley.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A couple whose car was hit by a truck on the M1 while on a journey to celebrate their wedding anniversary. Plus, a wing suit free-fall enthusiast who hit trouble when his main parachute became tangled up, 30 seconds from the ground. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: New products include a unisex t-shirt that repels water-based liquids and kills odour-causing bacteria and a Champagne bottle opener. Presented by Lucy Alexander.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals begin with a spectacular challenge as the nine remaining contestants head to the Royal Navy base in Portsmouth, where they have to cook for HMS Diamond's Trafalgar Night celebration dinner. Split into three teams, they face the enormous challenge of mass catering at fine-dining level from the ship's galley. They then return to the MasterChef kitchen, where they must create a dish to hold onto their hard-fought place in the competition, with two being sent home at the end by judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Westminster, presented by Alicia McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: City in the Sky
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Hannah Fry present a documentary exploring aviation, beginning with a look at the challenges of getting aircraft into the air. The programme features a visit to the world's busiest airport to discover the work that goes into getting its millions of visitors off the ground. Plus, the construction of the world's largest passenger plane and the dangers of taking off from the coldest city on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of Whizz-Kidz, a charity working to transform the lives of disabled children across the UK, supporting them to become confident and independent young adults.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts as Jill and Steve take on Charlotte and Michael, putting their knowledge of antique collectables to the test whilst competing to build the most valuable collection for a chance to win Â£1,000.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to British monarchs from the time of George IV to the reign of the present Queen.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Peter Ebdon v Matthew Stevens. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2002 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott and Len Goodman head to Bradford, where the Strictly Come Dancing judge has his first taste of a Pakistani curry and samples some Latvian cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: David Harper and Adam Partridge search for items to sell at auction at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Britain's longest-running industrial strike.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown (?)
programme.desc: Darren and Emma prepare for their first-ever cattle show, but before that they have to beat seasoned breeders Grania and Simon at their local Launceston Show.(n)

programme.title: The Brecon Beacons with Iolo Williams (?)
programme.desc: Iolo explores the Brecon Beacons during summer and autumn, witnessing sheep being gathered by shepherds on horseback in the Black Mountain foothills and dedicated volunteers try to repair the mountaintop. In the Usk Valley, bats feed before they hibernate in caves and migrating ducks on Talybont Reservoir ready for winter.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind (?)
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the sixth and concluding semi-final of the quiz, inviting four returning contenders to brave the black chair once more. They answer questions on the specialist subjects of Teotihuacan, Derry Girls, the Silk Road, and Olympic fencing, before they each have two minutes to demonstrate their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Ken Dodd: How Tickled We Were (?)
programme.desc: A celebration of the life and work of the comedian, recounting his life from his boyhood growing up in the 1930s in Knotty Ash through to his big break and continued career in showbusiness. Dodd's career spanned 50 years and after his rapid rise to stardom, he maintained his presence via countless television and radio shows, theatre tours and summer seasons with work ranging from pantomime to Shakespeare. He also enjoyed a spell as a successful recording artist and remained active until just a few months before his death aged 90. This programme features contributions from his friends and colleagues and includes an interview with his widow Anne.(n)

programme.title: Blackpool: Big Night Out (?)
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the Lancashire seaside resort through the eyes of acts who have performed there. Blackpool was once at the heart of the British entertainment industry and launched the careers of Morecambe and Wise, as well as attracting world-famous artists including Frank Sinatra. With contributions by Ken Dodd, Roy 'Chubby' Brown, Syd Little and Cannon and Ball.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Sicily: Wonder of the Mediterranean (?)
programme.desc: Michael Scott concludes his history of Sicily, telling the story of how the Christian Byzantine Empire was swept aside by a Muslim Arab invasion from North Africa. The island was transformed by new trade networks and agricultural techniques, and in the 19th century was unified with Italy - but the greatest threat to their prosperity then came from within and the rise of the Mafia.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown (?)
programme.desc: Farming friends Mark and Sean launch their Herefordshire-inspired crisps at the Droitwich Food Festival, while horticultural pioneer Sophie sells her Juneberry gin.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile (?)
programme.desc: In the first edition of a new look for the programme, Anita Rani is on her home patch in east London to discover what lockdown means for Woodberry Wetlands and what the future holds for the animals of Hackney City Farm. At home, she gets stuck into reinvigorating her garden and cooks up a barbecue tandoori. Adam Henson reveals the effects of the pandemic on farming and Tom Heap investigates how a new British land army might work for fruit and veg growers.(n)

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve (?)
programme.desc: A journey around the region, examining the challenges currently facing the nations in the area. In the first episode, Simon visits Malta, uncovering the country's reputation for organised crime, before moving on to the southern coast of Italy, where he joins police officers exploring underground tunnels used by crime bosses on the run. Finally, he arrives in Albania and discovers an ancient tradition of revenge where children can pay the price for their parents' actions.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera (?)
programme.desc: A doctor and a paramedic operate on a mountainside to save a hiker who fell 650ft, while a motorist takes evasive action when a car heads towards him on the wrong side of the road.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right (?)
programme.desc: More products are put to the test, with consumers unboxing, trying out and giving their feedback on a gadget for wheelie bins, a measuring tool and dry shampoo for children.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop (?)
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival is Suzanne from London, who hopes that mechanical expert Steve Fletcher can bring a decorative wind-up bird cage that once belonged to her late mother back to its former glory. Meanwhile, church wardens Brian Tidswell and David Dickinson bring in a selection of carved angels for wood restorer Will Kirk to repair. Elsewhere, an old Georgian peat bucket and a surgeon's leather case are restored by experts Dominic Chinea and Suzie Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: City in the Sky (?)
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Dr Hannah Fry examine the advanced technology needed to ensure the safety of the one million people estimated to be travelling by plane at any given time. They discover the daily routines of air traffic controllers in the busiest airspace in the world and pilots flying thousands of miles at night. Plus, transporting horses by planes and in-flight medical advice.(n)

programme.title: Alex Polizzi: Chefs on Trial (?)
programme.desc: MasterChef meets The Apprentice as Alex Polizzi takes on the challenge of finding new head chefs for restaurants that have a desperate need to fill a vacancy. Over four nights, she offers up a total of nine candidates who are put through a rigorous interview and testing process, with only the very best making it through to the final. She begins her search at The Gilpin in the Lake District, a fine dining establishment whose family owners want to find a new executive head chef who will care as much about the business as they do.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics (?)
programme.desc: Ken Doherty v Paul Hunter. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2003 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure (?)
programme.desc: The pair reach Leicester, where Len Goodman braves his first ever Indian curry and samples a selection of Greek cuisine. Chef Ainsley Harriott heads to the kitchen to create spiced fish cakes, inspired by the day's adventures in the city.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Natasha Raskin Sharp are at Culzean Castle in Ayrshire to assess items including a toy car from Germany and an art deco Carlton Ware vase. Paul Martin presents.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis test their general knowledge in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, with a winner declared each Friday.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown (?)
programme.desc: Representatives of two inner city London charities head to the 46th Lambeth Country Show to raise awareness and raise funds for their important community work.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: The teams embark on the final leg of their journey, heading off on the 4,800 kilometre trek to the finish line in Ushuaia, Argentina, the most southerly city in the world. However, as they prepare to leave the last checkpoint, one of the teams reveals that they have run out of money and will not be completing the challenge. The three remaining pairs rely on different tactics to get ahead, benefiting from risky gambles, lucky opportunities and the kindness of strangers.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect (?)
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality redesigns for a spacious Wiltshire home that used to be a hair salon - so is poorly designed for actually living in, with a ground floor that feels like two separate properties, each with its own front door. Laura gives the building a welcoming entrance while making the interior family-friendly and functional, while Robert comes up with an innovative approach that cuts down on the amount of floor space but which could radically alter the way the owners live.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory (?)
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a liqueur factory in Ireland that produces 540,000 bottles a day. He tracks the journey of a bottle of cream liqueur through the three-year production timeline. At the other end of the journey, Cherry Healey discovers where the empty bottles are recycled. Plus, historian Ruth Goodman visits a monastery to discover the spiritual origins of liqueurs.(n)

programme.title: I'll Get This - Extra Helping (?)
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes, Stacey Solomon, Joe Sugg, Alice Levine and Phil Wang go out for dinner together. They play a series of games, with the loser picking up the bill for the whole group.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Hubble: The Wonders of Space Revealed (?)
programme.desc: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Simon Parkin host the edition first shown on July 27, featuring performances by Bros, Simple Minds, Kirsty MacColl, the Primitives, Gloria Estefan, Inner City, Simply Red, Sonia and Alice Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Our Musical History
programme.desc: The duo reveal the songs that shaped their respective musical journeys. James picks Tina Turner's epic Proud Mary rendition as one of his all-time greats and Beverley introduces him to Big Mama Thornton - a woman who taught Elvis a thing a two before revealing how she felt when the opportunity to sing with her idol presented itself. Plus, the raw stadium rock vocal of Steve Tyler, the soaring acoustic purity of Eva Cassidy, the intensity of Otis Redding and the passion of Prince. Whitney Houston sings live to an audience of millions, Tom Jones returns to Wales to deliver one of his classic hits and a pitch-perfect George Michael serves to blow the roof off Wembley stadium.(n)

programme.title: Disco at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances of disco classics by acts including Chic, Rose Royce, Labelle, Gladys Knight and Village People, from shows such as Top of the Pops, The Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Tessa Dunlop and Neil Oliver explore the Irish Sea shoreline that fringes the coasts of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Tessa goes in search of new experiences and tales from these shores, hitching a ride on a Liverpool tug-boat, crossing the Irish sea on a luxury cruise liner, and seeking out a surviving sister ship of the Titanic.(n)

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Cromford in Derbyshire, which was at the heart of 18th-century industrialist Richard Arkwright's mechanised cotton mills and a textile revolution. Ben discovers Cromford became a new kind of village, built to service the enterprise of this powerful man.(n)

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming's exploration of the English canal network continues across the Pennines from Marple to Huddersfield, where his journey is hampered by a fallen tree and a leaking lock pound.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Exploring the mountains of Dhofar in Oman, where the annual Indian Ocean monsoon has helped create a lost world of waterfalls and cloud forests filled with fascinating wildlife. The programme shows green sea turtles coming ashore in their thousands, shadowed by egg-stealing foxes, as well as footage of striped hyenas doing battle with Arabian wolves. Plus, a glimpse into the lives of chameleons, honey badgers and the elusive Arabian leopard.(n)

programme.title: King Lear
programme.desc: Richard Eyre's adaptation of Shakespeare's tragedy, starring Anthony Hopkins as the ageing monarch who decides to divide his kingdom between his three daughters, only to turn against the youngest and banish her when she refuses to flatter his ego. The remaining sisters are corrupted by their newfound power and drive him into the wastelands, at a terrible cost to his sanity, while the land is plunged into chaos and civil war. With Emma Thompson, Emily Watson, Jim Broadbent, Andrew Scott and Florence Pugh.(n)

programme.title: Get Animated! BBC Introducing Arts
programme.desc: Film critic Ali Plumb celebrates emerging animators making fresh short films, which feature malicious toasters, cheeky Glaswegian pigeons, job-haunting ghosts and smelly fungi.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of British Animation
programme.desc: Documentary exploring animation in the UK from the Victorian era to the present day, taking in the work of Bob Godfrey, John Halas & Joy Batchelor, Len Lye and Aardman Animations, and examining the ingenious methods that low-budget British productions have used to create their own distinctive styles.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: The gang suspects Mr Ratburn is secretly a superhero when he receives mysterious calls and displays apparently superhuman strength.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock must find an inventive way of getting rid of a noisy pest who is preventing them from getting to sleep.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: A fanatical cult adopts Danger Mouse as its leader and its members start living life a little too dangerously.(n)

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mouse buys a video game that is supposed to teach the family teamwork.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Neil the wimpy lion is under pressure from his overbearing mother-in-law to 'man up' and 'get buff' - like previous alpha-male lion Maximus.(n)

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: When Danny is too tired to take on Lance in the annual ping-pong competition, Mick is forced to extreme lengths to get his brother the nap he needs.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Blue Peter join Children in Need and Comic Relief for music, dancing and magic!(n)

programme.title: Craft Party
programme.desc: The art goes intergalactic as Curtis and Georgia craft a spaceship for their very own lunar landing, while India and Ethan discover other lifeforms in the kitchen by making alien marshmallow pops.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Dad Gordon arranges a trip into the middle of the Californian countryside for Tilly, mum Tana and sister Holly. Later, Tilly makes a colourful summer salad and a watermelon pizza.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: Four artistic gymnasts from Birmingham hope to take the world by storm..(n)

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: My Dog Ears follows the journey of 12-year-old Joe who is hoping to receive a very precious gift - a dog that will become his ears. Joe has been profoundly deaf since he was a baby and a specially trained hearing dog could bring him the independence and confidence he so craves. Only 30 children in the UK have one of these dogs and Joe is next on the waiting list, but his journey isn't straightforward. Joe also has a Titanium leg and needs an operation to help him walk before he can receive his dog. Can Joe fully recover from his surgery and complete the training that will allow him to have a new best friend - his very own hearing dog?(n)

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Several of Oscar's robots become lost in town and Olive and Otto must help him find them.(n)

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Otto and Olive must figure out why people in town are becoming plaid and striped.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The team takes a look at America and its various Presidents, from George Washington to the present day, including President Jackson's rude parrot.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: A real-life King Kong shows Steve who is boss, and a scaly thief is caught red-handed..(n)

programme.title: Deadly Nightmares of Nature
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson tracks animals that seem weird, dangerous or scary. In this edition, she explores the southern tip of Africa, searching a cemetery for an unusual frog and observing a spiny mammal that only comes out at night. She also examines a subterranean world and comes across a family pet with a difference.(n)

programme.title: Operation Ouch
programme.desc: How the human body makes different types of tears to protect your eyes in different ways.(n)

programme.title: Show Me What You're Made Of
programme.desc: The five intrepid work-experiencers head to Grimsby, where they join a team of strictly supervised workers running one of the city's biggest fish-processing factories.(n)

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Junior witch Mildred Hubble struggles to find her place at Miss Cackle's Academy. Children's fantasy drama, based on Jill Murphy's books of the same name, starring Bella Ramsey.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: My Perfect Landing
programme.desc: Jenny struggles to adapt to Gus's off training methods while preparing for a qualifier..(n)

programme.title: My Perfect Landing
programme.desc: Jenny's cousin Sarah visits and puts Jenny in a tough spot when she stands up to Olivia..(n)

programme.title: My Perfect Landing
programme.desc: Whitney and Gus confront their past and work through their issues, and Whitney finally embraces Jenny's dream of competing and agrees to be her coach at Hillside..(n)

programme.title: My Perfect Landing
programme.desc: Jenny prepares for the Hillside battle and relives moments of her past.(n)

programme.title: Nikki Lilly Meets
programme.desc: Vlogger and baking ace Nikki Lilly meets some of the world's biggest stars for a quick chat and some tasty bakes.(n)

programme.title: The Playlist
programme.desc: Big names from the world of pop introduce a selection of most requested tracks, as decided by viewers, while Greg James unveils the official weekly UK top 10 chart.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: Four artistic gymnasts from Birmingham hope to take the world by storm..(n)

programme.title: The Snow Spider
programme.desc: Gwyn ventures out to battle against the mighty Efnisien with his Snow Spider safely returned, but he is unaware that Eirlys and Alun have followed him.(n)

programme.title: The Real Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: Jermaine Johnson, who plays Wozza in Jamie Johnson, meets up with gifted footballer Ezra. Signed to a top academy at six years old, he regularly returns to the grassroots club in south London where he learnt his skills, in order to keep his competitive edge. Jermaine joins him for the final session before the new season starts, but will he be able to cope with the pressure and keep up with the high standards?(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter Bites
programme.desc: Lindsey Russell tries her hand at American football with a girls' team in Leeds, and discovers why the sport is growing around the world.(n)

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: It's the first day of term at Malory Towers and new girl Darrell Rivers can't wait for a fresh start! But whilst she's keen to settle in, will her past come back to haunt her?(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Ryan's fear of failure threatens to overwhelm him when he volunteers at a stables.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Educational programme for children aged between four and seven.(n)

programme.title: Baby Jake
programme.desc: Nibbles the Rabbit joins Baby Jake on a countryside adventure.(n)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies do conga dances over the hills, then they conga into Home Dome to answer the Tubby Phone and do a special conga Tubby Phone Dance. In Tummy Tales, children have lots of fun as they conga around a soft play centre.(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Ooo Ooo hosts a banana party, prompting Raa Raa and friends to gather too much of the fruit.(n)

programme.title: Postman Pat: SDS
programme.desc: Pat needs to deliver some special jet boots for the school's Festival of Flight, but they get taken by Ajay instead.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The friends go to the park to feed the ducks. Sula proves good at standing quietly and giving the mallards just the right amount of food.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The bunny is horrified to discover that his carrot has accidentally been thrown into the blender after Flop suggests making a smoothie.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee's makes some delicious pancakes, but the clubhouse is out of honey. Energetic animation for children aged two to five, following Duggee the dog and his Squirrel Club.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is having a lovely cup of tea in his favourite cup when Roly surprises him with a very loud 'Peek-a-Boo', which is so loud that Duggee jumps and drops his cup which shatters into pieces.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The heroes try to save the world's stinkiest plant being turned into a perfume.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Benjamin gets more than he bargained for when a group of mice mistakes him for a hero and ask him to help them retrieve their frozen peas.(n)

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The crew helps reunite a lost sardine with its friends.(n)

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Yabba is given a drum to play, but Timmy is determined to exchange it for his triangle.(n)

programme.title: The Furchester Hotel
programme.desc: A knight named Sir Gary checks into the Furchester Hotel after hearing about all of the many problems going in inside the hotel, and decides that he wants to help.(n)

programme.title: Biggleton
programme.desc: oad Sweeper Keven has lots to do keeping Biggleton neat and tidy while Archie the Gardener is on holiday. When all the leaves fall off the trees, Keven and Rowan the Chef try to find ways to stick them back on. Evie the Artist tries to help too, but nothing seems to work. When Keven borrows Amelia the Scientist's latest invention, the leaves go everywhere. Keven and his friends need to clear up the mess before Archie returns from his holiday.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble would like to hear a bedtime story, but not before he gets ready for bed. Meanwhile, Justin experiences a magical bedtime adventure with his friends.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter meets some surprising new friends at Hill Top Farm, but when a big storm hits the woods, it's up to the rabbit to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch's giant ball game threatens El Castillo, so the Go Jetters attempt to save it.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The adventure-seeking superheroes race to fix the Leaning Tower of Pisa in Italy. But has it really been glitched?(n)

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Ashley Kendall, Aimee Campbell-Nottage, Donna Mullings and Simon Herdman present a poetry programme using a mix of sign language, the spoken word, music and animation to bring poems to life and capture the imaginations of both deaf and hearing children.(n)

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Robert is being judged for a special robot award, but is too nervous to pass all the tests - so Justin decides to take them for him.(n)

programme.title: Andy's Prehistoric Adventures
programme.desc: Andy Day plunges into an underwater prehistoric adventure, 150 million years back in time, in search of a giant swimming reptile the size of an elephant. However, after being chased by a scary shark he finds himself lost at sea.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: George gets locked inside Mrs Hobbs' house and Waffle has a chance to prove himself to Mrs Hobbs. Can he rescue George?(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle has so much fun on a doggy playdate at Mr Willow's house that he decides to stay for a sleepover. However, the Brooklyn-Bells miss Waffle and cannot wait for his return. With the voice of Rufus Hound.(n)

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: Topsy discovers a lost cat sleeping on her bed, and the twins try to find out who it belongs to - but locating the owner is not as easy as they thought it would be.(n)

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Je'naÃ© is cooking her favourite meal of Jamaican saltfish and cabbage.(n)

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Woolly helps Tig keep her patience when she makes a cake, but then has to wait for it to bake in the oven.(n)

programme.title: Melody
programme.desc: Mum takes Melody to visit a cathedral. The partially sighted girl feels the carved wooden door, picking out different shapes. She asks Mum for some church door music, and Beethoven's Symphony No 5 is duly chosen.(n)

programme.title: Down on the Farm
programme.desc: Storm Huntley finds out about radishes. JB Gill goes to market with a farming family to buy a new ewe and lambs, then goes in search of some baby animals.(n)

programme.title: Where in the World
programme.desc: On a hot day in Peru, seven-year-old Angel feeds his family's chickens, ducks and turkeys, and checks on the recovery of an injured pigeon. In Ghana, Tyra, who's five, is at nursery school, singing, dancing, and having a delicious lunch. And in Italy, Mario, who is seven, and lives in Sicily, enjoys a family walk up Europe's tallest volcano, Mount Etna.(n)

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Four-year-old twin brothers Josh and Zac, and their five-year-old brother Nathan see who can draw the biggest chalk dragon on the garden patio. Then it's pizza for dinner and the three brothers become pizza chefs! They add lots of toppings to their pizza's, but how will they taste?(n)

programme.title: What's the Big Idea
programme.desc: Hugo learns that one of the benefits of going to school is meeting his friends.(n)

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.desc: Dr Ranj treats Jobi who has a bump on his head, and Nurse Morag makes sure that the healthy helpers wear helmets for their big egg race.(n)

programme.title: Footy Pups
programme.desc: Rachel Yankey teaches her team all about following instructions. Meanwhile, manager Freddie takes a holiday and leaves Fleabot 3000 in charge at Pupton Park.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin has lots of summer fun with his friends, and Mr Tumble judges the Best Kept Garden.(n)

programme.title: Ferne and Rory's Vet Tales
programme.desc: Ferne Corrigan visits Chloe and Ella and their pony Twiggy who is about to give birth to a foal. Rory Crawford meets a zoo vet who is checking on a very large lizard.(n)

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know
programme.desc: Maddie learns how the life cycle of a butterfly works and finds out how wallpaper is made.(n)

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bob can't go to his friend Phoebe's party because she has measles. This puts a stop to his aim to try and beat his previous record of shooting 4 basketball hoops in a row. Bitz decides to throw the best beach party ever to make up for it. There are snacks, games, a dance floor and even a basketball hoop! But it's a very warm day and soon everyone is too hot to party. Will they have to give up and call it a day or can Bitz find a way to cool everyone down so that Bob can try and beat his record?(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The four adventure-seeking superheroes must help when the geysers in Iceland are blocked - Glitch is to blame and it could cause an earthquake.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie forgets her reading book, so Waffle takes it to her PE class at school.(n)

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Ashley Kendall, Aimee Campbell-Nottage, Donna Mullings and Simon Herdman present a poetry programme using a mix of sign language, the spoken word, music and animation to bring poems to life. This instalment re-enacts The Sorcerer's Apprentice, by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe.(n)

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Kari is fascinated by how a pinwheel moves in the wind - can she make one of her own?(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: African folk tale, telling the story of why fleas jump.(n)

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: The presenter travels back in time to the era of the Triceratops, a plant-eating dinosaur which roamed the plains of North America.(n)

programme.title: Katie Morag
programme.desc: Spring arrives, but Katie Morag and Grannie Island become worried when Alecina falls ill after lambing.(n)

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Sarah needs new shoes, but chooses an unusual pair.(n)

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: A loose tooth worries Lola, despite Charlie's reassurances that a new one will grow in its place.(n)

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: The animated adventures of an energetic baby monkey and his long-suffering mother, who take a light-hearted approach to problem-solving and teamwork as they tackle life's challenges together.(n)

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Major gives three froglets medals for helping him, but the other froglets are jealous.(n)

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The friends run around the garden so much that Makka Pakka cannot wash their faces.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois and her friends take a shine to hunky reporter Dallas, who looks set to replace Tom Tucker as news anchor, Brian pretends to be a millionaire to impress a new love interest.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine decides to hold a party to get to know her neighbours, but Stan becomes suspicious of an Iranian couple. In an attempt to find evidence to support his hunch, he breaks into their house and is thrown into jail. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger cause a power failure, sparking fears of a terrorist attack.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the animated comedy about a CIA agent who will stop at nothing to protect his country. Stan volunteers to help son Steve impress the hottest cheerleader around. When he fails to make him a hero, he rigs the school elections and transforms the lovestruck youngster into a power freak.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Donna decides to run for a place on the school board and keeps her husband away from the campaign in case he embarrasses her. Junior discovers he has a natural talent as a diver, but his chances of success are threatened when he is too shy to wear the school's tight swimming trunks.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: The Browns pack their bags and move to Los Angeles, where Cleveland plans to make his dream of being a baseball scout a reality. However, his new job fails to live up to expectations, and when he befriends struggling actress Gina (guest star Krysten Ritter), he discovers that life in California is not quite as glamorous as it seems. Meanwhile, Donna launches a new career as a children's entertainer.(n)

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Action-packed game show, with commentary from Irish comedy duo the Rubberbandits. Ten contestants are given 50 lives to take on a series of tricky challenges. The aim of the game is to complete five of them without losing all of their lives. Challenges include Tiny Bike, Dizzy Hurdle and Groin Croissant.(n)

programme.title: ITV2 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Game of Thrones and Aquaman star Jason Momoa, who discusses his line of drinking water, Mananalu Water.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: Kerry Washington chats about Little Fires Everywhere and chef Jose Andres talks about his efforts to ensure people have food and hospitals have masks..(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three singletons try to impress dental nurse Cece in Cardiff, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes she liked best.(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: In London, Amanda, Katy and Alex battle it out to impress Georgina with their style choices. With nothing but their chosen outfits to help her decide, who will Georgina choose to take out on a first date?(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including a mustard-swallowing challenge that backfires and a teenager who finds a cockroach in his dinner. Plus, one 'lucky' lady receives a marriage proposal made out of faeces.(n)

programme.title: Animals United
programme.desc: A lion and a meerkat go in search of water after the building of a dam cuts off their supply. On the way, they meet various other animals whose habitats have been destroyed by humans and resolve to do something about it. Animated comedy with the voices of James Corden, Stephen Fry, Jim Broadbent and Joanna Lumley.(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski.(n)

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula opens a luxury resort for monsters, to provide a refuge from terrified humans. His cosy sanctuary is disrupted when a normal man unwittingly checks in, and the situation is complicated when the unwanted guest turns out to be the descendant of a famous vampire hunter - and takes a liking to the count's daughter. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is the new coach of Quahog's minor league baseball team and accidentally becomes the face of social justice when he kneels during the national anthem after overeating.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: After the local airline pilots go on strike, Quagmire looks for new work and becomes a gigolo. When his clients begin to avoid paying for his services, he asks Peter for help getting his money. Meanwhile, Brian is kicked off Peter's health insurance, so he gets a job at a hardware store, until Stewie gets him fired and things 'get medical'.(n)

programme.title: Home Alone with Joel Dommett
programme.desc: The comedian presents an entertainment show from his home. Featuring celebrity call-ins, comedy interviews, and games with self-isolated viewers around the country, and providing a glimpse into Joel's everyday life.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: James Woods takes viewers behind the scenes at the Family Guy studios to offer a peek at a production week of the series to see what goes into the making of the show.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Taylor Swift agrees to go to a homecoming dance with Chris after he asks her via online video. However, when she starts to fall for him, her music takes a hit. Meanwhile, Peter decides to try a new profession and sees firsthand what it's like to be an Uber driver.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mayor West raises the drinking age to 50, leaving Brian - thanks to dog years - the only one old enough to buy alcohol for Peter.(n)
